findings.title: Unprotected function calls
findings.description: The functions 'tryAdd', 'trySub', 'tryMul', 'tryDiv', and 'tryMod' are unprotected and can be called directly.

findings.title: Lack of access control
findings.description: The functions setBuybackMultiplierSettings, setIsDividendExempt, setIsFeeExempt, setBuyBacker, setFees, setFeeReceivers, setSwapBackSettings, setTargetLiquidity, and setDistributionCriteria do not have proper access control.

findings.title: Unsecured token transfer
findings.description: The smart contract allows unsecured token transfers which can lead to unauthorized transactions.

findings.title: Unvalidated user input
findings.description: The smart contract does not validate user inputs properly, which can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Insecure approval mechanism
findings.description: The approveMax function allows unlimited approvals without proper validation.

findings.title: Insufficient testing coverage
findings.description: The test cases do not cover the code sufficiently, which can lead to undiscovered vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Unaudited code sections
findings.description: The provided audit report does not explicitly mention 'Unaudited code sections' as a finding. However, it can be inferred that some functions were not audited since only function signatures are listed without any corresponding findings.

findings.title: Insecure constructor usage
findings.description: The contract uses a public constructor which can lead to unauthorized access and manipulation of the contract's state.

findings.title: Unprotected external calls
findings.description: The contracts removeLiquidityETHWithPermit and swapExactTokensForTokens contain unprotected external calls.

findings.title: Insecure token ownership transfer
findings.description: The smart contract allows the owner to execute transfer of contract ownership to a specified wallet or a dead address, which can lead to loss of control over the contract.

findings.title: Unvalidated token balances
findings.description: The smart contract does not validate token balances before performing operations, which can lead to unexpected behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Insecure dividend distribution
findings.description: The DividendDistributor contract has an insecure dividend distribution mechanism.

findings.title: Unprotected buyback functionality
findings.description: Smart contract can buyback tokens from the total supply without any protection.

findings.title: Unsecured liquidity management
findings.description: The project's liquidity is not locked, which can impact the project's longevity and security.
